appropriations: The Capital Improvement Projects appropriation for FY 2026 has been updated based on a committee recommendation, increasing the total from the Judiciary's initial $9.9 million request to a proposed $11.9 million. The additional $2 million is intended for the relocation of the Children's Justice Center. The operating budget request remains unchanged.
revenue_sources: The amount to be funded by general obligation bonds for Capital Improvement Projects has been recommended for an increase to $11.9 million. This is an increase from the Judiciary's initial request of $9.9 million. The change is pending further deliberation by the Committee on Finance.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The one-time capital expenditure for FY26 is now projected to be $11.9 million in bond funds, reflecting a committee recommendation to add $2 million to the Judiciary's initial $9.9 million request. This increase is designated for the Children's Justice Center relocation. Other projections for operating costs remain consistent with the previous note.
capital_expenditure_impact: The total requested capital expenditure for FY 2026 has been updated from the Judiciary's original $9.9 million request to a recommended $11.9 million. This reflects a proposal by the House Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs to increase the lump sum appropriation from $5 million to $7 million. The additional $2 million is to cover costs for relocating the Children's Justice Center.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the revision of the Capital Improvement Project (CIP) funding request for FY 2026. The previous fiscal note stated a total CIP of $11.9 million. This new note clarifies that this amount originates from a recommendation by the House Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs to increase the Judiciary's original request of $9.9 million by $2 million to specifically fund the relocation of the Children's Justice Center.
